sentences.en: A prolonged drought had necessitated the introduction of water rationing.
sentences.cn: 由于持续干旱，用水需要实行配给了。

sentences.en: a prolonged period of dry weather
But Alfred had deduced that the Danes were no longer fit for prolonged battle.
sentences.cn: 但是,阿尔弗雷德已经推断出,丹麦人已不再适应持久的战争了.

sentences.en: Goodyear could be vulnerable in a prolonged economic slump.
sentences.cn: 经济长期疲软可能会对固特异公司造成影响。

sentences.en: He did not want his life to be prolonged by artificial means.
sentences.cn: 他不想靠人为方式延长生命。

sentences.en: In a prolonged course the hooves, horns and hair may slough.
sentences.cn: 在病程长的病例中,蹄壳 、 角和被毛可能脱落.

sentences.en: North Vietnamese stonewalling doomed Cambodia, however, to prolonged agony.
sentences.cn: 然而北越人的拖延战术却使柬埔寨惨遭长期的磨难.
拖长了的谈判并不是大家所想要的。

sentences.en: The fall in inflation is the silver lining of the prolonged recession.
sentences.cn: 通货膨胀的下降是长期经济衰退中的一线转机。

sentences.en: The general trend under heaven is that there is bound to be unification after prolonged division and division after prolonged unification.
sentences.cn: 天下大势,分久必合,合久必分.

sentences.en: The meeting was prolonged into the evening.
The treaty has been prolonged for another ten years.
They were impoverished by a prolonged spell of unemployment.
sentences.cn: 他们因长期失业而一贫如洗.

sentences.en: Thoughts of Melanie's prolonged suffering spurred Scarlett to action.
sentences.cn: 这时思嘉想起媚兰受了很久的折磨,觉得必须即刻行动了.

sentences.en: Two countries prolonged signing an agreement until details could be agreed on.
sentences.cn: 两国推迟签约直到就细节达成协议.
